Articles.Content: I'm trying to reach lightspeed by modifying existing parts so that it doesn't take forever and I don't run out of fuel. I've got the fuel part down, but I can't move the thrust above a fairly low level without the entire ship exploding upon liftoff. I've tried changing the values for drag and for mass, but I can't find anything that will allow me to increase the thrust more. Does anyone know what I could do?

Use struts to spread the forces out over the whole rocket; this will help limit the amount of strain on any single part. It won't solve the problem if you have really insane thrust, but it'll help.

Also, relativity isn't modeled in KSP, nothing really happens at lightspeed, and in fact you can go way faster if you really start modding things.

Chop the mass of the entire rocket way down and the same amount of thrust will do much much more (without tearing things off, either).

Other options are upping attachment strengths (I forget what the fields are, wiki has 'em) or using the negative thrust liquids broken physics.
...also you shouldn't launch the rocket at maximum throttle. So many people do that

For me, I find this helps too, rather than giving your ship a collosal jolt at lift off, giving it the shakes, or the twists, or even the wobbles, I normally light the initial SRB's, then once clear of the tower increase thrust from the Liquids gently, but quickly, so as to have a good speed for when the SRB's are jettisoned...

This is true, start with barely enough thrust to just lift you off the ground and then slowly creep 'er up it should work better.

Otherwise, I've also found in my hideously gargantuan machines that if the engines can't support the weight of the rocket above, then I like to set deadweight boosters to the sides of the machine such that they are the only points of contact with the ground. After ignition of the main engines, I decouple and liftoff (This also negates the sticky launch pad bug, and is much closer to our earthly launch pads)

If your rocket is tearing itself apart when you turn the throttle to maximum, it means you're using engines that're too powerful and/or have room to carry way more fuel, IMO. Liftoff TWR shouldn't ever get that high.

Then again, I haven't really explored the various mod packs. Perhaps they have engines that are far too frail for their thrust.

I know this is out side the confines of the game and maybe cheating

But I was trying to get t the sun. I tweaked the std liquid engines (liquidEngine1) to maxThrust = 550 and fuelConsumption = 0.008

at first I tried using a large rocket but I fell asleep, when I woke up it was spinning wildly in all directions and was only 350,000 km from Kearth, at 15,000 m/s. Also I found a bug as iI was unable to point the ship away from Kearth, even after I jettisoned the extra tanks I could only maintain control for a very short time until I reach 31,000 m/s then it became uncontrollable again.

I am attempting it again with three SAS systems under the command pod. so far i am currently at 42,000km from Kearth at 183,000 m/s, there is some wobbling but the extra SAS systems seem to be doing the trick for now.... ;D

How I did it...

Solid Booster with mass of 1.

Minimal drag.

1 fuel

0 fuel consumption

thrust=4750

4750 is the green zone. The highest non-decimal thrust parameter that doesn't require custom SAS or human, errr... kerbling, input.
